qas.question: What are conformation shows also known as?
Who evaluates dogs at breed shows?
What is the judge looking for in specific breeds?
What is the only standard judged?
What is another word for "breed shows"?
What is the evaluator called in a breed show?
The breed standard only is about what?
Abilities and what else are not tested at breed shows?

context: In conformation shows, also referred to as <a0_0>breed shows<a0_0/>, <a1_0><a5_0>a judge<a5_0/><a1_0/> familiar with the specific dog breed evaluates individual purebred dogs for <a2_0>conformity with their established breed<a2_0/> type as described in the breed standard. As the breed standard only deals with the <a3_0><a6_0>externally observable qualities<a6_0/><a3_0/> of the dog (such as appearance, movement, and temperament), separately tested qualities (such as ability or <a7_0>health<a7_0/>) are not part of the judging in <a4_0>conformation shows.
